title: Robotics Series A fundraising metrics benchmarks
summary: Series A robotics benchmarks focus on fleet-scale performance, deployment efficiency, and business metrics. Investors evaluate whether you've proven the model works at scale and can achieve sustainable unit economics. These benchmarks demonstrate production maturity. Pitchchat keeps fundraising metrics investor-ready in one room.

metrics.label: Fleet Size
metrics.note: Total robots in production operation. Indicates deployment scalability and market acceptance.

metrics.label: Task Success Rate
metrics.note: Fleet-wide success rate with consistency across sites. Production-grade reliability is required.

metrics.label: Runtime Hours
metrics.note: Cumulative operation hours demonstrating reliability and real-world validation.

metrics.label: Customer Count
metrics.note: Active customers with deployed robots. Segment diversity reduces concentration risk.

metrics.label: Annual Revenue
metrics.note: Revenue from robot deployments including hardware, software, and services.

metrics.label: Net Revenue Retention
metrics.note: Revenue retention including expansion. Proves customers finding increasing value.

metrics.label: Gross Margin
metrics.note: Blended margin across hardware and services. Should show improvement trajectory.

metrics.label: Deployment Time
metrics.note: Time to production operation at new site. Should show systematic improvement.

metrics.label: Support Ratio
metrics.note: Fleet coverage efficiency. Should improve with better tooling and processes.

metrics.label: Customer Churn
metrics.note: Customer retention rate. Low churn validates lasting value delivery.
